p: The first historical records related to human use of palm oil date back to five thousand years ago, when it played an essential role in the mummification process in Egypt [ 3]. Its use in manufacturing, including artisanal and industrial production, subsequently spread to Western Africa, Asia and, later, Europe. Its use for food purposes became considerable in the nineteenth century, when it became one of the most widely used vegetable oils in the food industry [ 3].
